answers.answer: Hi,You could be having tension headaches or the headaches could be due to your blood pressure or hyploglycemic episodes which are not so uncommon in pregnancy. What you need to do is get your blood pressure and blood sugar checked. Also try to take a short nap in the afternoon. Try some pregnancy exercises in consultation with your gynecologist. Do not exert yourself. Adeuate sleep is important and so is avoidance of alcohol and smoking. Also report any heartburn or gastroesophageal reflux symptoms you might be having to your doctor which could also cause the headaches. Drink plenty of fluids and eat frequent small meals. Goodluck.

Hi,One of the causes of headache during pregnancy is poor posture and the tension from the extra weight that you are carrying. Practice good posture esp so since you are carrying twins. Also apply cold compress or ice pack at the base of your neck whenever you get a headache, it helps. Rest in a dark quiet room and get a neck or shoulder massage.Eat balanced meals and do light exercise after consulting your obstetrician.Take care!

Could you get these headaches early on in pregnancy as well.  I don't know that I'm pregnant, hoping I am - but for the past 6 days I have noticed that I'll get a dull headache in the afternoons.  I'm eating normally, drinking lots of fluids, and I get enough sleep.  Today I'm only 10 dpo (if I ovulated when I think I did) and know it's too early to test yet.  I just was wondering about this.

Hi,Pregnancy causes several changes in the body. Although the weigh  of the twins may cause some tension on your spine and may also cause some headaches, hormonal changes may also be a factor.Have you consulted with your OB/GYN regarding your blood pressure?Any diabetes, hypertension or history of cardiac problems?Do you still have persistent vomiting?What is wrong with your vision? Any blurring of vision?Increased blood pressure may also cause headaches and in pregnancy ,we have to consider the presence of preeclampsia which warrants medical intervention. I suggest you seek your OB opinion about this.I hope this helps.Good luck !

question: Hi - I am 25 weeks pregnant with twins and for the last 8 weeks I have had an afternoon neck/headache. It sometimes last only 5 minutes and other times for up to half an hour. I have never had this in the morning or at night. It is effected only by the movement of leaning forward, standing up or sitting down and is a dull pain. It isn't debilitating but just a little worrying. It seems to radiate from my neck, and when it comes on it causes pain when I move my right eye to the far left. I have had two examinations by an Ophthamologist and my optic nerve is normal. Is this a tension headache?
title: Pregnant with afternoon headaches
